sub_title: Senior Data Scientist | Machine Learning Engineer | Natural Language Processing Software Engineer | Deep Learning Engineer
summary: Senior Data Scientist / Machine Learning Engineer with 9 years of experience, building bridges between business and engineering whenever data involved. Mostly focused on understanding of customers’ behavior  and getting insights based on usage data, ready for full-development cycle from obtaining idea from stakeholders, through building and productionalizing pipelines and models, to proving via statistical tests and reporting results and preaching the data-driven approach. Have 5 years of experience in banking and finance related building of machine learning models in different appliances: fraud, recommendations, insights extraction. Hungry for new knowledge and open to new industries as well.

school.name: National Research Nuclear University MEPhI (Moscow Engineering Physics Institute)

profile_positions.title: Data Scientist

profile_positions.description:
Building machine learning model for CTR prediction, making possible
comparing on ad auction bids with different payment types: CPC and
CPM; initial model has negative R2, which was increased to 0.7-0.8
Building machine learning model for predicting ad auction bid
approval, as a result, with losing 1% of potential bids more than 50%
of traffic was filtered. Stack: Scala+H2O
Maintaining data pipelines in AWS environment, feature engineering,
sanity checking; regular data «exploding» through aggregation never
happened again
Leading DS group

profile_positions.title: Senior Data Scientist / Machine Learning Engineer

profile_positions.description:
At that moment, the bank already had pretty good DS team in retail part of business, while the corporate part wasn’t ready for good analyze: no calculating infrastructure, no master-base system, no fixed ID for customer. At their way to data-driven approach, the bank decided to remaster CRM-system and enhance it with sales-signals and pricing models. My duty was preparing everything for actual DS, develop several services for business needs and help bank to evolve from distributed storage systems (starting with several SQL-databases and ending with Excel files) and ad-hoc human decisions into 360-degree customer view and automated effective work.
Now we already have automatic collecting data into hdfs with prepared infrastructure for complex calculations and analyze from tenth of different systems, well-prepared documentation about data structure both from business  and IT view and interactions between them, formalized A/B testing for corporates, segmentations for several purposes, simple sales-signals model, started experiment with it and several business problems solved. 
Main projects:
    • Recommendation system for corporate banking customers.
    • Pricing models for different bank products.
Support projects:
    • Systemizing of data from different systems.
    • Fetching known customer data by partial information.
    • Ad-hoc solutions for specific product needs.
    • Exposing inter-system problems.
    • Challenging Head Office’s counterparts.
    • Mentoring intern.
profile_positions.title: Senior Data Scientist

profile_positions.description:
Senior programmer / Data Analyst / Data Scientist
Working at team of 2-4. Design and construct of several microservices, based on machine learning models, as: 1. Service, suggesting by text description of tender product it's class in national classifier, in example, that "sausages" is about "meat product" and "kefir" is "fermented milk product". As product names written by people in various (mostly, not so trivial) ways, simple statistic model was unsuccessful. 2. Service, suggesting measure for tender product by name ("meat" in "kilograms", while "kefir" in "liters"). 3. Recommendation system for tenders and potential providers of products. 4. Predicting probability of different events about company-provider (bankruptcy, misappropriation of money, credit delay and so on) Another scope of work is work with databases: fetching and combining data for training models, collecting and keeping data, merging of similar data from different sources (in example, gathered information about companies, mostly partial, and combining it). At last: one-time and regular parsers on python. Tools: Jupiter Notebook, pandas, nltk, gensim, scikit-learn, tornado, selenium, beautifulsoup, sqlalchemy, docker, nginx, Languages: python, SQL (postgres, mssql)
profile_positions.title: Data Analyst/Data Scientist

profile_positions.description:
1. Market statistical analyze. 2. Algorithms, machine learning and prototypes of inner and outer products: a. Car price evaluation (inner product for call center and algorithm for outer price calculator https://automama.ru/ocenka-avto ) b. Similar auto detection (for automatic “See another cars” widget and evaluation improvement) c. Blog text similarities (for automatic “See also” widget) d. Automatic search of interesting for company offers and dealers
3. Automatic report generating:
a. Developing and maintaining dashboard based on Shiny Dashboard
b. Data retrieving from different sources:
i. Databases (mongoDB aggregation and map-reduce, PostgreSQL, MySQL)
ii. Raw data (csv, html-tables)
iii. Excel files (including automatic executing of VB macro)
iv. CRM via API (Amocrm, Bitrix24)
c. Regular automatic sending of email reports via Outlook
d. Slicing and filtering data for funel and other kind of reports, according to requirements
4. Maintaining and improving of CRM automatic document operating (so-called Bitrix24
Business-Processes)
5. Analyze of rival companies and products: another automobile auctions and car price
calculators.
6. Writing specifications and tasks for developers, related to data retrieving (parsing advert
boards) and processing (database design).
profile_positions.title: Data Analyst/Data Scientist

profile_positions.description:
1. Fetching, sampling and processing data from client’s (usually – bank) database:
a. Hadoop/Hive
b. PostgerSQL
c. MongoDB
d. Raw dumps
2. Sanitizing and matching of raw data. Example:
a. There is special “city” field in card transaction, specifying place, where merchant,
accepted transaction, base. According to Visa manual, there is only one way to write “St
Petersburg” correctly, which is even mentioned in the document. However, transaction history I
saw shows more than 50 ways to write it incorrectly.
b. Some cities are so close to each other, that this relation can be (and it was) automatically
found. In example, “Zelenograd” and “Moscow”.
3. Generating of hypothesis about clients’ customers, testing, statistical analyze of
parameters, writing final code. Some examples:
a. Hypothesis: customer, who has regular transactions in places, classified as Gas Station,
also should have transactions in placed, classified as Service Stations. Analyze shows, that
“regular” means “mean time before nearest transactions less than or equal 7 days”
b. Hypothesis: high volume transaction at grocery store will greatly raise the probability of
next transaction at taxi service. Analyze shows that “high volume” is “Twice as median volume for
this customer” and “greatly raise” is just few percent.
c. Hypothesis: buying of plane tickets leads to transactions in another city in several
months. Analyze shows that we should expect that in 2-12 weeks.
4. Training model and predicting behavior based on hypothesis and facts.
5. Side-projects with financial data, such as:
a. Churn-prediction (clients: “585 Gold” – jewelry shop)
b. Cross-sale (“Alfa-bank” – bank)
c. Other predictions (“Volga-Dnepr”)
d. Client clustering (“CFT” – b2b services for banks)
6. Leading of small group of analytics (just daily briefs about results and plans).
7. Creating of working prototypes and generating data, that imitates real customers (for
cases of our work demonstrating without NDA violating).
profile_positions.title: Data Analyst/Data Scientist
